item.text: David thought to himself, “One of these days I’m going to be swept away by the hand of Saul! There is nothing better for me than to escape to the land of the Philistines. Then Saul will despair of searching for me through all the territory of Israel and I will escape from his hand.”
So David left and crossed over to King Achish son of Maoch of Gath accompanied by his 600 men.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">settled</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="0397" class="">Achish</st> in <st data-num="01661" class="">Gath</st>, <st data-num="01931" class="">along with</st> his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0376 01004">and their families</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> had with him his <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>, <st data-num="0293" class="">Ahinoam</st> the <st data-num="03159" class="">Jezreelite</st> and <st data-num="026" class="">Abigail</st> the <st data-num="03762" class="">Carmelite</st>, <st data-num="05037" class="">Nabal’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">widow</st>.
When Saul learned that David had fled to Gath, he did not mount a new search for him.
David said to Achish, “If I have found favor with you, let me be given a place in one of the country towns so that I can live there. Why should your servant settle in the royal city with you?”

So <st data-num="0397" class="">Achish</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> him <st data-num="06860" class="">Ziklag</st> on <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>. (<st data-num="03651" class="">For that reason</st> <st data-num="06860" class="">Ziklag</st> has <st data-num="01961">belonged</st> to the <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.)
The length of time that David lived in the Philistine countryside was a year and four months.
Then David and his men went up and raided the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites. (They had been living in that land for a long time, from the approach to Shur as far as the land of Egypt.)

When <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> would <st data-num="05221" class="">attack</st> a <st data-num="0776" class="">district</st>,<n id="1" /> he would <st data-num="02421" class="">leave</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">neither</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> nor <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="02421" class="">alive</st>. He would <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>, <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st>, <st data-num="02543" class="">donkeys</st>, <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st>, and <st data-num="0899" class="">clothing</st> and would then <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">back</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0397" class="">Achish</st>.

When <st data-num="0397" class="">Achish</st> would <st data-num="0559" class="">ask</st>, “<st data-num="0413 04310">Where</st><n id="1" /> did you <st data-num="06584" class="">raid</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">today</st>?” <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> would <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, “The <st data-num="05921 05045">Negev</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>” or “The <st data-num="05045" class="">Negev</st> of <st data-num="03397" class="">Jerahmeel</st>” or “The <st data-num="0413 05045">Negev</st> of the <st data-num="07017" class="">Kenites</st>.”

<st data-num="03808" class="">Neither</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> nor <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> would <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="02421" class="">leave alive</st> so as to <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> them back to <st data-num="01661" class="">Gath</st>. He was <st data-num="0559" class="">thinking</st>, “<st data-num="06435" class="">This way</st> they <st data-num="06435" class="">can’t</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">tell</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> us, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, ‘<st data-num="03541" class="">This is what</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st>.’” <st data-num="03541" class="">Such</st> was his <st data-num="04941" class="">practice</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">time</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> he <st data-num="03427" class="">lived</st> in the <st data-num="07704" class="">country</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st>.
So Achish trusted David, thinking to himself, “He is really hated among his own people in Israel! From now on he will be my servant.”
